code: @Manual{,   title = {saeczi: Small Area Estimation for Continuous Zero Inflated Data},   author = {Josh Yamamoto and Dinan Elsyad and Grayson White and Julian Schmitt and Niels Korsgaard and Kelly McConville and Kate Hu},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.0.9000},   url = {https://harvard-ufds.github.io/saeczi/}, }

title: Small Area Estimation for Continuous Zero Inflated Data
text: saeczi R package implements small area estimator uses two-stage modeling approach zero-inflated response variables. particular, working variables follow semi-continuous distribution mixture zeroes positive continuously distributed values. example can seen .  saeczi first fits linear mixed model non-zero portion response generalized linear mixed model binomial response classify probability zero given data point. estimation models applied new data points combined compute final prediction. package can also generate MSE estimates using parametric bootstrap approach described Chandra Sud (2012) either parallel sequentially.

title: Small Area Estimation for Continuous Zero Inflated Data
text: Install latest CRAN release : can also install developmental version saeczi GitHub :

title: Small Area Estimation for Continuous Zero Inflated Data
text: ’ll use internal package data show example use saeczi. two data sets contained within package contain example forestry data collected Forestry Inventory Analysis (FIA) research program. saeczi::samp: Example FIA plot-level sample data county Oregon. saeczi::pop: Example FIA pixel level population auxiliary data county Oregon. main response variable included samp ground live biomass small areas case counties Oregon. keep things simple use tree canopy cover (tcc16) elevation (elev) predictors models. can use saeczi get estimates mean biomass county well corresponding bootstrapped (B = 500) MSE estimate follows.
code: library(saeczi) data(pop) data(samp)  result <- saeczi(samp_dat = samp,                  pop_dat = pop,                   lin_formula =  DRYBIO_AG_TPA_live_ADJ ~ tcc16 + elev,                  log_formula = DRYBIO_AG_TPA_live_ADJ ~ tcc16,                  domain_level = "COUNTYFIPS",                  mse_est = TRUE,                  B = 1000L)

title: Small Area Estimation for Continuous Zero Inflated Data
text: function returns following objects: 36 total counties Oregon, just look first rows results:

title: Small Area Estimation for Continuous Zero Inflated Data
text: saeczi supports parallelization future package speed bootstrapping process, requires small amount additional work part user. enough just specify parallel = TRUE function signature future::plan must also specified. example uses multisession’ future resolution 6 threads:
code: future::plan("multisession", workers = 6) result_par <- saeczi(samp_dat = samp,                      pop_dat = pop,                       lin_formula =  DRYBIO_AG_TPA_live_ADJ ~ tcc16 + elev,                      log_formula = DRYBIO_AG_TPA_live_ADJ ~ tcc16,                      domain_level = "COUNTYFIPS",                      mse_est = TRUE,                      parallel = TRUE,                      B = 1000L)

code: saeczi(   samp_dat,   pop_dat,   lin_formula,   log_formula = lin_formula,   domain_level,   B = 100L,   mse_est = FALSE,   estimand = "means",   parallel = FALSE )

title: Fit a zero-inflation estimator. — saeczi
text: samp_dat data.frame domains, auxiliary variables, response variable sample pop_dat data.frame domains auxiliary variables population. lin_formula Formula. Specification response fixed effects linear regression model log_formula Formula. Specification response fixed effects logistic regression model domain_level String. column name samp_dat pop_dat encodes domain level B Integer. number bootstraps used MSE estimation. mse_est Logical. Whether MSE estimation happen. estimand String. Whether estimates 'totals' 'means'. parallel Logical. MSE estimation computed parallel

title: Fit a zero-inflation estimator. — saeczi
text: object class `zi_mod` defined `print()` `summary()` methods. object structured like list contains following elements: * call: original function call * res: data.frame containing estimates mse estimates * lin_mod: modeling object used fit original linear model * log_mod: modeling object used fit original logistic model

title: Fit a zero-inflation estimator. — saeczi
code: data(pop) data(samp)  lin_formula <- DRYBIO_AG_TPA_live_ADJ ~ tcc16 + elev  result <- saeczi(samp_dat = samp,                  pop_dat = pop,                  lin_formula = lin_formula,                  log_formula = lin_formula,                  domain_level = "COUNTYFIPS",                  mse_est = FALSE) #> Warning: Model failed to converge with max|grad| = 0.00715735 (tol = 0.002, component 1) #> Warning: Model is nearly unidentifiable: very large eigenvalue #>  - Rescale variables?;Model is nearly unidentifiable: large eigenvalue ratio #>  - Rescale variables?
